intro: Papualthia samarensis, commonly known as the Samarensis papaw, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the genus Papualthia, which is part of the family Annonaceae. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
